contentrichtext.text: {{dablink|This article is about a Canadian rock band. For the 1985 film see its director and writer's page [[Percy Adlon]]}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Zuckerbaby | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Calgary]], [[Canada]] | genre = [[pop rock]], [[Rock music|rock]], [[Alternative rock|Alternative]] | years_active = pre-1996–present | label = None, formerly Mercury/Polygram and Mercury/Universal | associated_acts = | website = [http://www.myspace.com/zuckerbaby MySpace page] | current_members = Andy Eichhorn – [[Singer|Lead vocals]], [[guitar]]<br />Reed Shimozawa – [[Guitar]], [[singing|vocals]]<br />Ed Tiegs – [[Bass guitar|Bass]], [[drum]]s <br />Ian Grant – [[Bass guitar|Bass]] | past_members = | notable_instruments = }} '''Zuckerbaby ''' is an [[Alberta]]-based rock band who found success in the late 1990s. "Andromeda", "Heavy" and "Shampoo" were singles released from their debut, self-titled album.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chartattack.com/news/27839/will-zuckerbaby-go-platinum-again-with-new-album|title=Will Zuckerbaby Go 'Platinum Again' With New Album|last=Kowal|first=Amanda|date=2000-08-01|publisher=[[Chart (magazine)]]|accessdate=2008-11-20}}</ref> Their second CD "Platinum Again" was released in 2000 and two singles were released from it ; "Overexposure" and "Holiday". ==Band members== *Andy Eichhorn - [[Singer|Lead vocals]], [[guitar]] *Reed Shimozawa - [[Guitar]], [[singing|vocals]] *Ed Tiegs - [[Bass guitar|Bass]], [[drum]]s (replaced Ted Koti in 1999) *Ian Grant - [[Drum]]s ===Former members=== *Brian Doss - [[Bass guitar|Bass]] *Ted Koti - [[Bass guitar|Bass]] (replaced Doss in 1998, and was replaced by Ed Tiegs in 1999) *Wayne Stadler - [[Drum]]s *Mark Freeland - [[Bass guitar|Bass]] *[[Kurt Dahle]] - [[Drum]]s (temporary for Stadler in 1998) '''The band also had co-writers for their Platinum Again album:<ref>[http://jam.canoe.ca/Music/Pop_Encyclopedia/Z/Zuckerbaby.html CANOE - JAM! Music - Pop Encyclopedia - Zuckerbaby<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>''' *Kevin McKenzie (from Damn The Diva) *Reggie Bibby *[[Todd Kerns]] (ex-[[Age of Electric]] and current [[Static in Stereo]] member) *[[Ryan Dahle]] (ex-[[Limblifter]], ex-Age of Electric member) *[[Dave Genn]] ([[Guitar]]ist and [[Keyboard instrument|keyboardist]] for the [[Matthew Good Band]]) ==Origin of the name== The name "Zuckerbaby" comes from a German art film, made in 1985, directed and written by [[Percy Adlon]].<ref>http://www.varsity.utoronto.ca/archives/118/mar09/review/Groovy.html</ref> The film is also known as ''Sugarbaby''. ==Discography== {| table border="2" class="wikitable" ! Year || Title || Label |- | 1996 || ''Ooh I'm So Pretty'' || Calgary Band Compilation (featuring Andromeda and Jealousy) |- | 1997 || ''Zuckerbaby'' || Mercury/Polygram |- | 2000 || ''Platinum Again'' || Mercury/Universal |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable" !align="center" valign="top" width="40"|Year !align="left" valign="top"|Song !align="left" valign="top"|Album |- |align="center" valign="top"|1997 |align="left" valign="top"|"Andromeda" |align="left" valign="top"|''Zuckerbaby'' |- |align="center" valign="top"|1997 |align="left" valign="top"|"Heavy" |align="left" valign="top"|''Zuckerbaby'' |- |align="center" valign="top"|1998 |align="left" valign="top"|"Shampoo" |align="left" valign="top"|''Zuckerbaby'' |- |align="center" valign="top"|2000 |align="left" valign="top"|"Overexposure" |align="left" valign="top"|''Platinum Again'' |- |align="center" valign="top"|2000 |align="left" valign="top"|"Holiday" |align="left" valign="top"|''Platinum Again'' |} ==References== <references /> ==External links== *[http://www.myspace.com/zuckerbaby Zuckerbaby's MySpace page] [[Category:Musical groups from Calgary]] [[Category:Canadian alternative rock groups]] [[Category:Musical groups with year of establishment missing]]
